task.summary: - Renamed some methods - Removed the private method that finds the Double Hash, in the Transaction Class. Instead, started using the static method included in the TLCUtilities class - Made changes to methods like getMerkleRoot to work properly - Create the TLCUtilities class - Completed (for now) testing of Block class methods - Made changes to the README.md file

- Renamed some methods - Removed the private method that finds the Double Hash, in the Transaction Class. Instead, started using the static method included in the TLCUtilities class - Made changes to methods like getMerkleRoot to work properly - Create the TLCUtilities class - Completed (for now) testing of Block class methods - Made changes to the README.md file

- Made some changes to the CryptoWallet (renamed to CryptoAccount, added the wallet address functionality) - created a test class for CryptoAccount (TestCryptoAccount) - created a simple class for coin transfers (CoinTransfer) - changed the test methods according to the new code - added some comments to the readme.md about the blockchain initialization

- Made some changes to the CryptoWallet (renamed to CryptoAccount, added the wallet address functionality) - created a test class for CryptoAccount (TestCryptoAccount) - created a simple class for coin transfers (CoinTransfer) - changed the test methods according to the new code - added some comments to the readme.md about the blockchain initialization
- Started working on the v2 verification.

- Changed the code. Now the coin transfer happens in two steps. a) The sender submits a transaction. b) The list of transactions submitted is verified. The verification (for now) includes (a) checking that the account balance of the sender is enough (b) verifying the sender's signature. Of course mining functionality must be added (nonce etc.) Also, the existing functionality needs more testing.
- Completed the proof of work algorithm and did some testing
- Started running more tests. Now I have an error with the Blockchain method that signs the transactions
- Almost completed testing my blockchain. One more test to write.
- Wrote a small language that can do some simple mathematical operations using the reverse polish notation.
- Started adding operations to my smart contract language. Each operation is added and tested.

- Changed the proof of work code, to check only the block header hash and not the block transactions hash. This way, as the bitcoin developer guide claims, proof of work won't take too long because it won't have to recalculate each time the hash of the transactions (the merkle root is enough)

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: - Changed the proof of work code, to check only the block header hash and not the block transactions hash. This way, as the bitcoin developer guide claims, proof of work won't take too long because it won't have to recalculate each time the hash of the transactions (the merkle root is enough)
